ranked_diseases.disease_name: Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with virilization (clitoral hypertrophy) in females and hyperpigmentation due to elevated ACTH. This is the most common form of CAH.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia due to 11-beta-hydroxylase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: Also presents with virilization and hyperpigmentation, but less common than 21-hydroxylase deficiency. May have associated hypertension.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia due to 3-beta-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase deficiency
ranked_diseases.explanation: Can cause mild virilization in females and hyperpigmentation, though typically presents with salt-wasting crisis early in life.
Causes virilization in females due to inability to convert androgens to estrogens. Hyperpigmentation is less typical but possible.
Can cause precocious puberty with virilization and café-au-lait spots (hyperpigmentation), though the pigmentation pattern is usually more specific.
Can cause elevated ACTH leading to hyperpigmentation and androgen excess causing virilization, though this is a rare condition.
